title.narrative: Social development for refugees and forced migrants in Egypt: Developing health and wellbeing and supporting access to long-term solutions

description.narrative:
The strategic objective of this project is to support social development for refugees and forced migrants by addressing health and wellbeing needs through health grants, community health awareness, and wraparound support.
This project aims to promote social development for refugees and forced migrants, addressing health and wellbeing needs through health grants, community health awareness, and wraparound support. The project will deliver three different, but complementary, interventions: - Providing 208 displaced adults and children have access to health services, through the provision of 415 heath grants - Providing 146 (70 percent of the above) additional case management support by StARS to further address health & wellbeing issues - Launching community health workshops and social media campaigns around COVID-19 awareness – prevention and response, Vaccinations, Prevention of infectious diseases and other
